p: Thymol and carvacrol have anticholinesterase activity reported by several authors, with different values of IC 50: 0.74 mg/mL (thymol) and IC 50 equivalent to 0.063 mg/mL (carvacrol) [ 45]; 0.212 ± 0.011 mg/mL (thymol) and IC 50 0.091 ± 0.011 mg/mL (carvacrol) [ 44]; 47.5 ± 1.08 mg/mL (thymol) and IC 50 182 ± 1.32 mg/mL (carvacrol) [ 46]. These studies have shown that the anticholinesterase activity of thymol is promising. Thus, the specimen of L. thymoides described in this work can be a natural source with potential for the development of new phytotherapics for the treatment of Alzheimer's disease or even be included in the diet of people with Alzheimer's. It is important to emphasize that in our previous work [ 47] it was shown that this specimen presents thymol as the majority constituent of essential oil throughout its seasonal cycle, which reinforces its viability as a source of obtaining this component.
